intro: Cephaelis grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered cephaelis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. The leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
